title: Create Diagrams with D2
text: d2 installed available PATH, can check version: D2 installed Homebrew, may trouble rendering diagram within RMarkdown. , may need set environmental variable points D2 PATH. Use d2_which() locate path installed version D2: See 2018 blog post Tony Tsai trouble-shooting PATH variable issues brew-installed commands. example basic diagram created d2_diagram():  can also pass unnamed lines text D2 syntax, specify connectors (used named elements), set overall direction diagram:  entity-relationship diagrams table schema can represented using SQL table style diagrams d2_sql_table():  can use d2_render() convert D2 file PNG, SVG, PDF, GIF file. d2_include() wrapper knitr::include_graphics() helps include diagram Quarto R Markdown document:
code:
library(d2r)  # Helper function for file paths fig_path <- \(x) {   paste0(knitr::opts_chunk$get("fig.path"), x) }  options("d2r.pad" = 10) d2_version() #> ℹ v0.6.3 <https://d2lang.com/releases/0.6.3> d2_which() #> [1] "/opt/homebrew/bin/d2" simple_diagram <- d2_diagram(   c("R" = "D2") )  simple_diagram #> [1] "R -> D2"  d2_include(   simple_diagram,   fig_path("simple_diagram.png") ) connected_diagram <- d2_diagram(   c("R" = "D2", "D2" = "R"),   "R.shape: oval",   "D2.shape: square",   connector = "->",   direction = "right" )  connected_diagram #> [1] "direction: right" ""                 "R -> D2"          "D2 -> R"          #> [5] "R.shape: oval"    "D2.shape: square"  d2_include(   connected_diagram,   fig_path("connected_diagram.png") ) mtcars_tbl <- d2_sql_table(mtcars[, 1:4], .id = "mtcars")  mtcars_tbl #> [1] "mtcars: {
    shape: sql_table
    mpg: dbl
    cyl: dbl
    disp: dbl
    hp: dbl
}"  d2_include(mtcars_tbl, output = fig_path("mtcars.png"), pad = 10) diagram <- d2_diagram(   c("Beginning" = "Middle",     "Middle" = "End",     "End" = "Beginning"),   "Beginning.shape: circle",   "End.shape: square",   direction = "right" )  diagram #> [1] "direction: right"        ""                        #> [3] "Beginning -> Middle"     "Middle -> End"           #> [5] "End -> Beginning"        "Beginning.shape: circle" #> [7] "End.shape: square"  d2_include(   diagram,   output = fig_path("include-example.png"),   sketch = TRUE,   theme = "Terminal" )

title: Render a D2 input file to an output file — d2_render
text: input Required input file "d2" file extension. output Output filename. fileext One : svg, pdf, png, gif, pptx. Ignored output supplied. layout Layout. One : elk, dagre, taga theme Diagram theme name code. Theme names case sensitive. Use d2_themes() list available themes. sketch TRUE, use hand-drawn style rendered diagram. pad Diagram padding pixels. Numeric value string coercible whole number. animate_interval Required fileext "gif" output uses "gif" file extension. font_family String font family name. Passed systemfonts::match_font() set regular, bold, italic fonts. Fonts must TTF file. D2 flag setting semi-bold fonts supported time. font_family can also provided named vector font family names elements named regular, italic, bold use different font family names different styles fonts. ... Additional input flags. Optional character vector. overwrite FALSE output exists, abort rendering. Defaults TRUE. auto_pdf Whether use PDF images automatically output format LaTeX. TRUE, e.g. foo/bar.png replaced foo/bar.pdf latter exists. can useful since normally PDF images higher quality raster images like PNG, output LaTeX/PDF. dpi DPI (dots per inch) value. Used calculate output width (inches) images. actual width pixels, divided dpi. provided, chunk option dpi used; NA, output width calculated. rel_path Whether automatically convert absolute paths relative paths. know sure absolute paths work, may set argument global option knitr.graphics.rel_path FALSE. error Whether signal error files specified path argument exist web resources.
